intro: Siphocampylus antonellii, commonly known as the Antonelli's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in open, sunny habitats. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
